In the OleEditor.createClientSite, when the OleClientSite is created there 
should be a try/catch block for an SWTException and also in 
OleEditor.oleactivate, there should be a check for clientSite == null.

Veronika,
   I am going to add the null checks but why did an exception happened in 
OleEditor.createClientSite?

Jiawei Ye,
   Could you check the .log file (in the metadata dir) to see if there is any 
other exception logged?

Eduardo,
The problem went away when I disable the NAV2002 Script Blocking feature. I 
just turned it on again and find that not only does it affected Eclipse but 
Word itself. I couldn't embed Word doc in Outlook mail correctly anymore. I 
assume that the exception originated from Word OLE function mishapen, not 
really Java or Eclipse oriented.

Jiawei Ye
So I am cloging to close this report.
*** Bug 15838 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Eduardo,

Sure, we have figured out why this was happening for Jiawei but the exception 
does not help other users who have the same problem.

You still need to catch the exception when the client site is created and do 
something reasonable.  I would suggest that you open a dialog to let the user 
know there was an error embedding the editor and open an external editor 
instead.

The SWTExecption is already being handled as any other runtime exception that 
may happen when creating an editor. I.e. another editor will be opened instead 
and a message printed on it informing the user that it was not possible to 
create the first editor. He can close it and open a external editor.

Closing this. Please reopen if you think that open the external editor 
automaticly is important.

Was a change actually made to fix this and if so in what build? An eclipse 
newsgroup post says the problem is happening in M5 (20020416) on NT 4.0 Service 
Pack 6.
*** Bug 15963 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
